headline: With the Venezuela operation, Marco Rubio is at the heart of reshaping the 'Western Hemisphere'
description: The secretary of state has fully embraced the MAGA movement and President Trump's ambitions. The Spanish-speaking Rubio is the chief architect of the US intervention and the main point of contact for Venezuela's new authorities.

headline: Maduro, a 'prisoner of war,' proclaims his 'innocence' before New York court
Venezuelan parliament swears in interim president after Maduro's ouster
By targeting Venezuela, Trump is also striking at China's interests
US attack on Venezuela: What does international law say?
Phil Gunson: If Trump does not force Venezuela to hold free elections, 'they can agree on almost everything'
Yoletty Bracho, political scientist: 'We Venezuelans want to reclaim our ability to exercise our citizenship'
Thailand accuses Cambodia of breaking cease-fire, Cambodia claims an accident
description: Phnom Penh called the incident 'an operational error,' while Bangkok stated that one of its soldiers was injured. A December 27 ceasefire had brought an end to three weeks of deadly fighting between the two countries, who have long disputed the demarcation of their shared border.

headline: US recommends fewer childhood vaccines in major shift
description: At the end of 2024, the Centers for Disease Control recommended 17 pediatric immunizations for all individuals. That number is now 11. President Donald Trump praised the changes, saying some of his base 'have been praying for these common sense reforms for many years.'

headline: At the Musée Matisse in Nice, the painter's 'Stations of the Cross' receives new light
description: The exhibition devoted to Henri Matisse's mural work – the artist's least loved but also the least studied creation – that was made for the Chapelle du Rosaire in Vence is finally the subject of an in-depth study.

headline: After Venezuela, Greenland fears US annexation
description: Following the US military intervention in Venezuela, Greenlanders, Danes and Europeans fear that the White House's next target may be the autonomous Danish territory that Donald Trump has coveted since his first term.

headline: Paris court finds 10 guilty of cyber-harassing Brigitte Macron
Djokovic pulls out of Australian Open lead-up in Adelaide
Macron criticizes 'method used' in US operation against Venezuelan leader Maduro
In Switzerland, grief and anger simmer, four days after deadly bar fire
Iran says no leniency for 'rioters' as protests persist
In photos: Snow falls on Paris
'Trump seeks to usher the Monroe Doctrine into a third era, that of post-Westernism'
Cold, snowy conditions ground flights and force train cancellations across northern Europe
Trump eyes new targets after toppling Maduro
Maduro's fate lies with US courts, as Venezuela's lies with Trump
For Putin, US operation in Venezuela is a double-edged sword
description: The capture of President Nicolas Maduro by the US weakens Ukraine's allies, who have positioned themselves as defenders of democracy and international law. It also deals a blow to Moscow, depriving it of a key partner and threatening its oil revenues.

headline: They cook organic, distrust science and oppose vaccines: America's 'crunchy moms' shift toward Trump
description: In the 1960s, the 'crunchy mom' was typically an American hippie trying to stay connected to nature. Today, she claims total freedom over health decisions, sometimes flirting with conspiracy theories.

headline: With Maduro abduction, Trump flexes muscles and sends world a message
description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro was abducted by US special forces. He is to stand trial before a federal court in New York on charges of 'narcoterrorism conspiracy.' Donald Trump has announced that the US plans to 'run' Venezuela up until a 'proper transition' and to exploit its oil reserves.

headline: The return of the US's predatory imperialism
'The US intervention in Venezuela violates foundational principles of contemporary international law'
'The Democratic Party is waiting for Trump's departure, praying his successors fail to revive Trumpism'
